item.description:
Come hear Kwame Somburu who was active in the mass movement against the Vietnam War and in organizing the Freedom Now party in Harlem, NY. He was part of the organizing effort for the major mass actions and conferences of the ‘60s.

He attended many of Malcolm X’s speeches and was present when he was assassinated. He was also featured on the TV show “Firing Line” with William F. Buckley Jr. He will speak about the rise of the mass movements and the lessons for activists today as we organize to confront the U.S. assault against the peoples of the Middle East, Central Asia, and right here at home.

Sponsors: Greater Boston Stop the Wars Coalition, New Socialist Project, Socialist Party of Boston

http://www.brothermalcolm.net/sections/malcolm/people/somburu.htm
(Malcolm X: Radical Tradition and a Legacy of Struggle conference - 1990)
http://vimeo.com/18611069  (William F. Buckley Show)
item.why: We are cosponsoring Kwame Somburu's speaking engagement during which he will discuss the black liberation struggle from the 1960s to today. Come join us!
item.name: Out Now! Black Power! --- Vietnam, the 60's and the Mass Movements
